# error

**Instance Property**

An object describing the error that occurred while processing the transaction.

## Declaration

```swift
var error: (any Error)? { get }
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/SKPaymentTransaction/error] property is undefined except when [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/SKPaymentTransaction/transactionState] is set to [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/SKPaymentTransactionState/failed]. Your application can read the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/SKPaymentTransaction/error] property to determine why the transaction failed. For a list of error constants, see SKErrorDomain in `StoreKit Constants`.

## Related Documentation

- **In-App Purchase Programming Guide**

## Getting Transaction Information

- **payment**: The payment for the transaction.
- **transactionIdentifier**: A string that uniquely identifies a successful payment transaction.
- **transactionDate**: The date the transaction was added to the App Store’s payment queue.
- **original**: The transaction that was restored by the App Store.
- **transactionReceipt**: A signed receipt that records all information about a successful payment transaction.
